page.title: 03TREES AND WOODLANDS
page.content: {TREES FOUND NEAR DUNSMORE Beech trees predominate here though the woodland is mixed Ash, Sycamore, Holly, Elm and Wild Cherry. Many of the Beeches are now nearing the end of thier natural life (150yrs) and each winter brings more casualties. They are also beset by honey fungus, a fatal disease. There is an example of a planted Beech avenue from Boswell's Farm to the A413 Wendover/ Amersham road. The sunken track from the now disused Leather Bottle pub is bordered by mature Holly trees and the lane from Smalldean Farm has 3 full_grown Copper Beeches in the hedgerow. There are a few HorseChestnuts and a few Oak trees in the clay on the top of Coombe Hill. The grounds of Chequers Court contain many different species; there is a tradition that each P.M. plants a new species.
